name: Vjacheslav Ignatyev
body:
Vjacheslav Ignatyev
![Vjacheslav Ignatyev](https://docs.google.com/document/pubimage?id=1p3vd2LSUMaZ2bgVG6SKQzDVZNISQP0WdFv_E3HNiLm4&image_id=1NKLdCdH_TlaSYnf8quqscyq6oGFWNxS-)Russia, Moscow

+7 (964) 629 3898

ivv.private@gmail.com

***

## Professional interests

Software systems design, data processing, networking.

## Education

Specialist (Engineer), Moscow Institute of Electronic Technology, Software of Computing Devices and Automated Systems, 1999-2008

## Experience

### LUXOFT (Russia, Moscow)

2011 - present time, Senior Software Engineer at UBS Bank Stream

Projects: Risk Hierarchy Master, Legal Entity Master.

I've designed and developed back-end and UI of the searching module, tuned sql-queries which dramatically increased application performance. I took part in user experience design. I've improved application lifecycle at building and releasing phases. I got experience with foreign partners affairs.

### LANIT-Samara (Russia, Togliatti)

2009 - 2011, Senior Software Engineer

Projects: Licensing of Business Activity, Multifunctional Service Center (are parts of “E-Russia” and “E-Government” federal programs), Standards of Government Services Portal, Rospotrebnadzor Portal, Certification Authority Front-End

As a participant of startup projects I had to take different roles. I took part in design and development of the "Core Process" platform on top of which were implemented projects. I've deployed development infrastructure. As a system integrator I installed and tuned applications, JVM, databases and OS. As a project manager I handled relationships with partners and customers. Once I took part in the defence actions against a DDOS attack.

### InfoLada (Russia, Togliatti)

2001 - 2009, Senior Software Engineer

Projects: CIS ILADA

I took part in the large "Generator of Information Systems" project. I was responsible for design and development of client and database sides. I collected requirements, wrote technical specifications. The platform had both user and programming interfaces so I communicated with customers and with developers. I introduced agile methods such as version control, automated build, dependency management, TDD into development process.

### Other projects

Projects: XML-Messages Processor, Indy.Sockets SChannel SSL Handler, Distributed Payment System Client

It was free time home work. I've developed high performanced modules for the partner's projects with low resources consumption. It was great experience with distributed team.


## Skills summary

* Object-oriented analysis and design, design patterns, desktop and web UI, server-side programming, performance tuning
* Agile practices
* Database design, data warehousing, reporting, SQL-query tuning, searching
* Java, Groovy, JavaScript, Object Pascal, C++, SQL, PL/SQL, XSLT, HTML, CSS, bash scripting
* J2EE, EJB, JSF, JCR, JMX, Servlet, Portlet, WSDL, SOAP, S/MIME, MS WinAPI, MS CryptoAPI, Java Crypto Architecture
* JBoss Seam, Spring, Enhydra Shark, Solr/Lucene, Hibernate, RichFaces, ICEFaces,  jQuery, Borland VCL, EhLib, JUnit, BouncyCastle, Oracle AQ
* Debuggers, profilers

## Software skills

* GNU/Linux, MS Windows, OpenVZ, VirtualBox, VMware
* DNS, DHCP, routers, firewalls, VPN, httpd, LDAP, XMPP, PKI
* Oracle DB, Postgres DB, Firebird, MySQL
* JBoss AS, Tomcat, Liferay Portal, JBoss ESB, OpenMeetings
* Emacs, GNU Core Utilities, Maven, Ant, Subversion, JMeter

## Personal activities
* My blog
* The "Feed Tables" project I made while learning Google App Engine and Clojure 

## About myself
I like to technologize every aspect of daily work. If something could be automated, it should be automated. If I had to choose one word to describe myself, this word would be "minimalism" - making a small change in Right place to achieve the Goal is my way to solve the problems.

You could find online version of resume.
